title: Problem Overview
content: Erdős Problem #958: For n points in ℝ² with k = n-1 distinct distances and multiplicities {n-1,...,1}, must the points be equidistant on a line or circle? Answer: NO. Clemen-Dumitrescu-Liu (2025) found arc+center counterexamples. SOLVED.
mathContext: k = n-1 distances, multiplicities {n-1,...,1} ⟹ line/circle? FALSE.

title: Distance Framework
content: Point := EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2). distanceSet(A) = set of distinct pairwise distances. multiplicity(A, d) = |{(p,q) : dist(p,q) = d}|. multiplicityMultiset(A) = multiset of all multiplicities.
mathContext: distanceSet A = {‖p-q‖ : p,q ∈ A}. multiplicity A d = |{(p,q) ∈ A² : ‖p-q‖ = d}|.

title: Standard Configurations
content: isEquidistantLine(A, n): n points on a line with a common direction. isEquidistantCircle(A, n): n points on a circle of radius r > 0. isStandardConfig(A): line or circle configuration.
mathContext: isStandardConfig A ≡ ∃ n, isEquidistantLine A n ∨ isEquidistantCircle A n.

title: Special Pattern and Conjecture
content: hasSpecialPattern(A): k = n-1 distinct distances and multiplicities form {1, 2, ..., n-1}. OriginalConjecture: hasSpecialPattern ↔ isStandardConfig for |A| ≥ 3. This conjecture is FALSE.
mathContext: hasSpecialPattern A ≡ |distanceSet A| = n-1 ∧ multiplicityMultiset A = Multiset.range(n-1) + 1. OriginalConjecture ≡ ∀ A, |A| ≥ 3 → (hasSpecialPattern A ↔ isStandardConfig A).

title: The Counterexample and Disproof
content: isArcPlusCenter(A, n): n-1 equidistant points on a short arc of a unit circle plus the center. clemen_dumitrescu_liu (axiom): for n ≥ 4, arc+center satisfies hasSpecialPattern but NOT isStandardConfig. conjecture_disproved (axiom): ¬OriginalConjecture.
mathContext: clemen_dumitrescu_liu: ∀ n ≥ 4, ∃ A, isArcPlusCenter A n ∧ hasSpecialPattern A ∧ ¬isStandardConfig A.

title: Erdős's Intuition
content: Erdős predicted NO — other configurations besides lines and circles would satisfy the special pattern. His intuition was confirmed by the 2025 result. Arc points at distance 1 from center with distinct arc-to-arc distances produce the right multiplicity structure.

title: Standard Configurations Analysis
content: Line case: n equidistant points at spacing s give distances s, 2s, ..., (n-1)s with multiplicities 2(n-k). Circle case: more complex pattern that also satisfies special conditions for certain n.

title: Examples
content: n = 4: special pattern requires k = 3 distances with multiplicities {3,2,1}. Both standard configs and arc+center satisfy this. n = 5: multiple non-equivalent configurations satisfy the special pattern.
mathContext: Examples: trivial (placeholders for n = 4 and n = 5).

title: Summary: SOLVED
content: erdos_958_summary: ¬OriginalConjecture ∧ (∀ n ≥ 4, ∃ counterexample). Proved from conjecture_disproved and clemen_dumitrescu_liu axioms. erdos_958_status: True (trivial). Problem is SOLVED — characterization is FALSE.
mathContext: erdos_958_summary: ¬OriginalConjecture ∧ (∀ n ≥ 4, ∃ A, isArcPlusCenter A n ∧ hasSpecialPattern A ∧ ¬isStandardConfig A) := ⟨conjecture_disproved, clemen_dumitrescu_liu⟩.
